description: Construction of 1x part three, four & five storey building and 1x part three, four, five & six storey building containing 85 flats (14 x 1 bed, 57 x 2 bed and 14 x 3 bed) including affordable housing, ground floor level car parking (64 spaces), landscaping, boundary treatment, and modifications to internal access road (following demolition of existing buildings)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Notwithstanding the submitted plans samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details.  Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 3.2, 4.1, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 3A.6 & 4B.1 of the London Plan 'The Spatial Development Strategy for Greater London (2008, Consolidated with Alterations since 2004), PPS 1 & PPS 3. | Prior to the first occupation of any of the residential flats hereby approved details indicating the positions, appearance, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected on the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details, which shall be completed before the residential units are first occupied and permanently retained thereafter.   Reason:  To protect the appearance of the area and the amenity of surrounding properties in accordance with policies 3.2, 4.1, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment', policies 3A.6 &  4B.1 of the London Plan 'The Spatial Development Strategy for Greater London (2008, Consolidated with Alterations since 2004), PPS 1 & PPS 3 | Details of the hard and soft landscaping to be undertaken within the site, including details of amenity space and children's play equipment for the children's play area shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units hereby approved. The details as approved shall be laid out and planted within the first planting season following the commencement of the development or such other period as may be agreed in writing with the local planning authority. Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size and species and in the same positions within the next planting season, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the local planning authority. This hard and soft landscaping shall be subject to a landscape management plan, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development. The landscaping shall thereafter be maintained and managed in accordance with the approved landscape management programme.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 3.2, 4.1, 4.5, 4.8 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 9: Trees and Development Guidelines, policies 3A.6 & 4B.1 of the London Plan 'The Spatial Development Strategy for Greater London (2008, Consolidated with Alterations since 2004), PPS 1 & PPS 3. | The car parking, disabled car parking and cycle parking spaces shown on the approved plans shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any of the residential flats hereby approved, the parking spaces shall be kept continuously available for car, cycle and disabled car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 	 Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking, disabled car parking and cycle parking within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 3C.1 of the London Plan 'The Spatial Development Strategy for Greater London (2008, Consolidated with Alterations since 2004), PPS 1, PPS 3 and PPG 13. | The development hereby authorised shall comply with 'The aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secured By Design.'  Reason: In the interests of crime prevention and the safety and security of users of the site, in accordance with policy 4.4 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) policy 4B.1 of the London Plan 'The Spatial Development Strategy for Greater London (2008, Consolidated with Alterations since 2004), PPS 1 & PPS 3, and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8: Safer Ealing. | On-site renewable energy production technology, energy efficient design and sustainable construction as described in the submitted Sustainability Statement (AA Energy Consultants 19/04/10 - AA-09-0061-r5) which would deliver at least a 20% carbon reduction, and meet Code for Sustainable Homes Level 3 shall be installed at the site prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and shall be permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: To ensure the proposal contributes to its renewable energy and energy efficiency requirements in accordance with policy 2.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP), 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and policy 4A.7 of the London Plan 'The Spatial Development Strategy for Greater London (2008, Consolidated with Alterations since 2004), PPS 1, PPS 3, and PPS 22. | The layout and design of the residential accommodation shall provide at least 8 of the proposed units and car parking spaces to wheelchair housing standards and the provision of all of the properties designed to Lifetime Homes Standards.  Reason: To ensure access for all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 4B.5 of the London Plan 'The Spatial Development Strategy for Greater London (2008, Consolidated with Alterations since 2004), PPS 1, & PPS 3, and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7: Accessible Ealing. | Refuse and recycling storage provision for this development should include a minimum of 14 x 1100 litre bins and additional recycling storage, and the gradients between the servicing point for refuse service vehicles and the refuse and recycling storage areas shall be no more than 1 in 12, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: To ensure that there is adequate refuse and recycling storage and management in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1, 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), PPS 1 & 3 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 (Refuse Storage). | The surface access road and turning area and parking spaces and associated works shall be completed and available for use prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units and thereafter these areas shall not be obstructed or used for any other purpose.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for access to the site and manoeuvring within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 3C.1 of the London Plan 'The Spatial Development Strategy for Greater London (2008, Consolidated with Alterations since 2004), PPS 1, PPS 3 and PPG 13. | All of the ecological measures as described in the ecological survey submitted with the application  (MALL119/001/003 Phase 1 Habitat Survey Thomson Ecology May 2010) including a bat survey and mitigation measures shall be implemented on the site in accordance with a programme of works to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. Once implemented any ecological measures shall be retained thereafter for the lifetime of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: In the interests of nature conservation and habitat protection and enhancement in accordance with policies 3.8 and 3.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (UDP), 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), PPS 1, & PPS 9. | Prior to the commencement of the development, details of a site construction method statement and management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The method statement/management plan shall include details of the following:  i). On-site construction worker parking ii). Anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site iii). Delivery times (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods) iv). Dust suppression measures v). Wheel washing provisions vi). Site security vii). Vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear. viii). Locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices viii). Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents. ix). A piling method statement (which the Local Planning Authority shall consult Thames Water & The Environment Agency on) x). A survey of the structural condition of the canal wall and a method statement (which the Local Planning Authority shall consult British Waterways on). xi). A risk assessment outlining all development works adjacent to the canal (which the Local Planning Authority shall consult British Waterways on). xii). A construction logistics plan, which explores the potential of this site to use the Grand Union Canal to transport bulk materials during the demolition and construction phase (which the Local Planning Authority shall consult British Waterways on). xiii) No infiltration of surface water drainage into the ground is permitted other than with the express written consent of the Local Planning Authority, which may be given for those parts of the site where it has been demonstrated that there is no resultant unacceptable risk to controlled waters.  Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  Reason:  To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and occupiers of the neighbouring sites and ensure adequate highway and site safety, and to ensure protection of controlled waters in accordance with policies 2.5, 4.4, 4.11, 9.1 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment)' (2004). | Notwithstanding the information contained on the submitted plans details of window position, design and orientation on the north (east and west) elevation on Block A and on the south ( east and west) elevation of Block B shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of development. The development shall be implemented only as approved and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason:  To minimise overlooking and to provide good living conditions to the future residents of the development in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 3A.6 & 4B.1 of the London Plan 'The Spatial Development Strategy for Greater London (2008, Consolidated with Alterations since 2004), PPS 1 & PPS 3. | Details of protecting sensitive rooms from external Category B & C noise to the following criteria including the provision of alternative ventilation to meet the situation when windows have to remain closed for insulation against noise shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of development. The development shall be implemented only as approved and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. The following noise criteria shall be met:  +	Bedrooms - not greater than 30Db (A) Leq, 1 hour (23:00-07:00 hrs). +	Living Rooms and Dining Rooms - not greater than 35 Db (A) Leq, 1 hour (07:00-23:00 hrs).  +	Kitchens, Bathrooms and Utility Rooms - not greater than 45Db (A) Leq, 1 hour (07:00-23:00 hrs).  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), PPG 24 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10: Noise and Vibration. | Prior to the commencement of any works on site (other than demolition and site clearance), a contaminated land investigation shall be carried out, using sampling points and methods agreed with the Local Planning Authority and subsequently a risk assessment shall be prepared, following the CLEA guidance.  A scheme shall then be submitted for approval to describe the proposed methods of removal, neutralising or sealing of the contamination, and for the remedial works to be implemented in accordance with a phasing programme to be agreed in writing by the local planning authority. All decontamination works shall be carried out prior to the first occupation of the flats hereby approved.   Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area in accordance policies 2.7 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of any external lighting to demonstrate compliance with the Institution of Lighting Engineers at Guidance shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development.  The lighting as approved shall be installed prior to the first occupation of any part of the development and maintained in accordance with the approved standards thereafter.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, the visual appearance of the area and the wildlife within adjacent views of open space in accordance with policies 3.8, 3.9, 4.1, 4.4,  4.8, 4.12 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (UDP), 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 3A.6 & 4B.1 of the London Plan 'The Spatial Development Strategy for Greater London (2008, Consolidated with Alterations since 2004), PPS 1 & PPS 3. | Details of a scheme for the fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms on the Ruislip Road facade of the 5/6 storey block at the northern end of the development for mitigation of exposure to poor air quality shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of development. The development shall be implemented only as approved and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason:  To provide good living conditions to the future residents of the development in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of a surface water drainage scheme for the site, based on sustainable drainage principles and an assessment of the hydrological and hydro geological context of the development, and details of foul water drainage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development. The development shall be implemented only as approved and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: To prevent the increased risk of flooding, to improve and protect water quality, improve habitat and amenity, and ensure future maintenance of these in accordance with policies 2.5, 3.8 and 3.9 of the Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), & PPS 25.
